topic.title: Navigate GLPI modules
topic.shortdesc: Navigation through the modules is done via the top bar of the interface.

body.p:
The various functions of GLPI are grouped into six modules. These modules were built around similar contexts of use. The top bar of the interface is used to navigate between these modules :
The module Assets provides access to various hardware inventory. See .
The module Assistance allows to create and track tickets, as well as view statistics. See .
The module Management allows to manage contacts, vendors, budgets, contracts and documents. See .
The module Tools allows you to manage notes, knowledge base, reservations and view reports. See .
The module Administration provides administration of users, groups, entities, profiles, rules and dictionaries. It also allows the application maintenance (backup and restore database, check if a new version is available, etc.). See .
The module Setup provides access to general configuration options of GLPI: dropdowns, components, notifications, SLAs, checks, automated tasks, authentication, receivers, external links, plugins. See .
The menus presented to the user vary depending on the clearances of the logged in user. See .
The browsing context is presented to the user in the breadcrumb.
There are keyboard shortcuts used to navigate from one module / sub module to another. Here is the list of these shortcuts :
The key combination to associate with these shortcuts varies by operating systems and browsers used. Examples for the following browsers :

ul.li:
Mozilla Firefox
Simultaneously press the keys Alt, Shift and the desired shortcut.

Internet Explorer 7 and above
Simultaneously press the keys Alt, Shift and the desired shortcut, then tap Enter to validate the destination.

Opera
Simultaneously press the keys Esc, Shift and the desired shortcut.
